meta.name: Today 3rd Hour
meta.description: A news program intended to inform, entertain, inspire and set the agenda each morning. Each daily live broadcast provides current domestic and international news, weather reports, and interviews with newsmakers from the worlds of politics, business, media, entertainment and sports.

videos.title: Laurie Hernandez
videos.overview: July is a month filled with discounts, so NBC's Vicky Nguyen stops by TODAY to break down the major discounts, sales and freebies coming this month — and what to hold off on for later. Managing busy schedules and separating your work from your personal life can be challenging, often leading to burnout. Peak performance expert and author Delatorro McNeal II joins TODAY to share his tips on living life to the fullest, setting boundaries and getting rid of that run down feeling. A public library in New Jersey is giving new meaning to the phrase "something borrowed, something new" by lending out a collection of more than 100 vintage wedding dressed to brides in need. TODAY's Dylan Dreyer reports. TODAY fitness contributor Stephanie Mansour shares functional exercises inspired by different sports to channel your inner athlete including additions and modifications for fitness at every level. Low-impact workouts like pilates are in high demand — and going viral on social media! TODAY's Craig Melvin tries out reformer Pilates and explores how the workout could be beneficial for both men and women.

videos.title: John Anderson, Jesse Ashlock, Chef Ash Fulk
videos.overview: From treating cuts and bruises and making your own bug bite cream, to water safety tips and more, NBC News medical contributor Dr. Natalie Azar joins TODAY to share medical advice to stay safe this summer. John Anderson has been combing the beaches of the Pacific Northwest for almost 50 years, finding everything from messages in bottles to a collection of unique Japanese glass buoys. Now, his treasure trove is on display at his museum. "There's a lot of history and there's a story in everything," he says. NBC's Gadi Schwartz reports for TODAY. Nothing says summer like hitting the road! Conde Nast Traveler's Jesse Ashlock joins TODAY to share road trip ideas for all kinds of journeys — whether you're looking for something in the Northeast, a small town vibe, an iconic drive on the California coast and more. School is out, which means many parents are trying to keep their kids busy! Toy Insider's editor-in-chief Ali Mierzejewski joins TODAY with some fun toy ideas to keep them entertained this summer. Chef Ash Fulk stops by Studio 1A to share his recipes for a flavorful grilled pork tenderloin and cauliflower steak with a homemade marinade.

videos.overview: TODAY's Al Roker is turning 70 and his wife, Deborah Roberts, pulled off an epic surprise bash joined by everyone from the TODAY family and performances from none other than Earth Wind & Fire! From scheduling appointments and medical exams before your insurance deductible resets for the year, to essential medications to keep in your home, NBC's Dr. John Torres joins TODAY to answer viewer-submitted questions around staying safe and healthy for the rest of 2024. Veuve Clicquot, and its iconic yellow label, was founded in 1772 in the Champagne region of France. NBC's Keir Simmons shares the story of the brand that has become synonymous with celebrations — and a tour of its historic vineyards on TODAY. Ashley Graham and Emma Grede join TODAY to talk about the new season of "Side Hustlers" on the Roku Channel where they help aspiring female entrepreneurs hoping to turn side hustles into empires. Graham and Grede share the progress of their investments from the first season and reveal their favorite thing about each other as friends.

videos.title: Eve Hewson
videos.overview: Jannik Sinner and Aryna Sabalenka stop by Studio 1A to talk about their victories at the U.S. Open and share how they celebrated. Sabalenka also reveals details on the temporary tattoo her coach got on his head! Hilary Hoffman, a celebrity trainer and founder of Soto Method, stops by Studio 1A to share a five-minute exercise to work out your arms that you can do anytime, anywhere. Shop TODAY contributor Makho Ndlovu stops by Studio 1A with to share favorites for fall, from cozy clothing to a beauty bundle — and they come with exclusive deals and discounts! Stefani Berkin, president of R New York, joins TODAY to weigh in on what the landmark National Association of Realtors settlement could mean for buyers and sellers, as well as the biggest housing trends for the fall.

videos.title: Sue Bird, Megan Rapinoe
videos.overview: James Beard award-winning chefs Michael Solomonov and Steven Cook join TODAY to share two Israeli-inspired recipes from their new book called "Zahav Home" for a tahini Caesar salad and couscous paired with meatballs. "The Sing Sing Files" author and Dateline producer Dan Slepian shares how his new book explores the criminal justice system and the toll on families when the system fails. Slepian details how he spent two decades exploring how innocent people end up imprisoned for crimes they didn't commit and is now telling the stories of some of the people he has helped free. WNBA All-star and Olympic champion Sue Bird and soccer icon and World Cup winner Megan Rapinoe join TODAY to discuss their popular podcast "A Touch More" and the lifestyle change after retirement. Purely Elizabeth founder Elizabeth Stein went against the grain to build a booming, better-for-you granola business. She sits down with TODAY's Jill Martin to celebrate the company's 15th anniversary, discuss early business growth and her outlook on success." The greatest gifts in life happen when we step out of our comfort zone and you do the hard things that you could have never imagined doing," she says.

videos.title: September 11, 2024
videos.overview: In the latest installment of "Cooking with Cal," Dylan Dreyer, joined by her son Cal, makes an easy weeknight meal for Caesar chicken and all they need is just five ingredients! Rotten Tomatoes' Jacqueline Coley joins TODAY to share TV shows and movies to watch this September including the highly anticipated "Beetlejuice, Beetlejuice," George Clooney and Brad Pitt's on-screen reunion in "Wolfs" and more. When dealing with difficult times it can be hard to know how to move forward and find peace. Psychotherapist Niro Feliciano shares tips on showing up for yourself and others, communicating emotions and surrounding yourself with the right people. From the new Amazon Echo Spot to LG's water-resistant portable speaker, Tech-life columnist for USA Today Jennifer Jolly shares the hottest gadgets to shop this season. NBC News medical contributor Dr. Natalie Azar joins TODAY to share healthy habits you can start now to feel better as you age such as focusing on calcium in younger years, scheduling movement once a day and finding stress lowering activities. As food prices continue to rise, Amazon is targeting inflation-weary consumers with a new discount grocery line offering hundreds of budget-friendly food items. NBC's Vicky Nguyen reports for TODAY.

videos.title: Lenny Kravitz, Suki Waterhouse
videos.overview: Lenny Kravitz joins TODAY to talk about his Las Vegas residency starting in October and reveals the creative process behind his 12th album, "Blue Electric Light." Singer-songwriter Suki Waterhouse joins TODAY to dish on her night at the VMA's and her upcoming album "Memoir of a Sparklemuffin." She also discusses opening for Taylor Swift at Wembley Stadium and her 6-month-old baby with Robert Pattinson. "He really excels at diaper changing — and enjoys it," she says. From Charlotte Tilbury's Magic Cream to an innovative deodorant balm and a detangling hairbrush, Oprah Daily editorial director Pilar Guzman joins TODAY to share the winning products from the annual "O-Wards." Orly Gottesman and Josh Borenstein are the couple behind NYC's Modern Bread and Bagel, a gluten-free bagel shop with goodies for everyone! TODAY's Dylan Dreyer talks to the founders on their innovative flours, creative delicious desserts and the journey of growing their business from one shop in 2019 to six shops nationwide.

videos.title: Rickey Smiley
videos.overview: Comedian Rickey Smiley, who has entertained audiences across the country with his morning radio show, stops by TODAY to open up about his new book, "Sideshow: Living with Loss and Moving Forward with Faith," that touches on the death of his son Brandon last January.

videos.title: Dwyane Wade, Dwyane Wade Sr., Sarah Rafferty, Patrick J. Adams
videos.overview: NBA superstar Dwyane Wade sits down with TODAY's Craig Melvin to discuss the unveiling of his brand-new, Miami Heat statue and explains the meaning behind the pose. His dad, Dwyane Wade Sr., joins him and opens up about the pride he feels toward his son. Actors Sarah Rafferty and Patrick J. Adams join TODAY to share how they are reuniting to watch "Suits" for the very first time to give fans behind-the-scenes insight into the show with their new podcast "Sidebar." From trick-or-treating routes to food allergies, NBC'S Vicky Nguyen joins TODAY with tips to enjoy a safe Halloween without any of the frights. From sun salutations to the chair pose, yoga instructor and owner of Yoga Shanti, Colleen Sandman Yee, joins TODAY to share yoga basics to keep you feeling your best. (Sponsored by UnitedHealthcare Medicare Plans).

videos.title: Reba McEntire, Paul Bettany, Tom Papa, Chef Bobby Flay
videos.overview: Chef Bobby Flay stops by TODAY to share recipes for mouthwatering porterhouse pork chops and a creamy polenta from his new cookbook, "Bobby Flay: Chapter One: Iconic Recipes and Inspirations from a Groundbreaking American Chef." Paul Bettany joins TODAY to discuss his new film, "Here," that focuses on a single place and all the people who live there and their stories of love, life and loss that all take place there spread out over generations. He talks about working with Tom Hanks and shares a hilarious story about him and discusses the upcoming ‘Vision' series in the Marvel universe. Tom Papa joins TODAY to discuss his new comedy special on Netflix, "Tom Papa: Home Free," which features his candid thoughts on becoming an empty nester. He also reveals his dream guests for his podcast "Breaking Bread with Tom Papa" and opens up about his new hobby of baking sourdough bread. Reba McEntire and Rex Linn join TODAY to talk about their sitcom "Happy Place," and what it's like to play a couple on-screen while being together in real life. McEntire also discusses her efforts to revive her hometown of Atoka, Oklahoma with her new restaurant, Reba's Place. NBC News medical contributor Dr. Natalie Azar joins TODAY to share her tips on how to identify and battle fatigue while refueling your energy, including avoiding caffeine in the afternoon and hydrating properly.

videos.title: Eli Manning, Joe Manganiello
videos.overview: NFL legend Eli Manning joins TODAY to celebrate his pro football Hall of Fame nomination and shares how fans in 30 NFL cities can experience the Super Bowl in a new way with Verizon's FanFest. Manning also breaks down his predictions for the playoffs ahead of Super Bowl LIX. Joe Manganiello joins TODAY with a preview of Season 2 for "Deal or No Deal Island" featuring a new female banker and wild challenges. Manganiello also talks about his animal print fashion, his dog Bubbles, and then shares motivation for people with fitness goals in the new year. From beach vibes in Turks & Caicos to nature views in Anchorage, Alaska, Jacqui Gifford, editor-in-chief of Travel and Leisure, joins TODAY with a list of some of the top travel destinations for 2025. Start TODAY's Stephanie Mansour, Ngo Okafor and Raven Ross share workouts from the brand-new app to get your fitness journey started.

videos.title: Guy Pearce
videos.overview: Ski resort workers have entered their second week of striking, causing chaos at the height of ski season with visitors are reporting long lines and a lack of communication. NBC's Liz Kreutz reports for TODAY. Actor Guy Pearce sits down with TODAY to chat about how he got into character to play the dark debonair Harrison Lee Van Buren in "The Brutalist." Pearce also discusses his favorite roles he's played throughout his career, including Andy Warhol in "Factory Girl." Recent data reveals that 1 in 5 Gen Zers are actively using social media sites to land jobs. NBC's Savannah Sellers chats with several young professionals who have found jobs through social media, whether through being recognized for creative content they've posted, by sending direct messages to prospective employers or by responding to open roles posted by companies themselves. The new year is a good time to start planning doctor's visits, so NBC's medical contributor John Torres stops by TODAY to share how to best prepare for your doctor's appointments, including what screenings to ask for, what to bring to an appointment, and more.

videos.title: Diane Warren
videos.overview: From setting your thermostat between 68 and 70 degrees to properly sealing your home, NBC's Vicky Nguyen joins TODAY to share ways you can save on home heating and electricity bills during the winter months. Missy Tannen, mom and co-founder of Boll & Branch, sits down with TODAY's Jill Martin to share how she created the multimillion dollar bedding company with the purpose of helping people sleep better at night. Songwriting legend Diane Warren joins TODAY to talk about her new documentary "Diane Warren: Relentless" which chronicles her career, working with icons including Celine Dion, Whitney Houston and more. The documentary is in theaters January 10 and MasterClass January 16. From ditching the "all or nothing" attitude to embracing saying "no," psychotherapist and author Niro Feliciano joins TODAY to talk about the importance of giving yourself grace in the new year. Nisha Vora joins TODAY to make two dishes from her new cookbook, "Big Vegan Flavor:" Creamy tahini lentils with crispy spiced garlic and a dark chocolate mousse made from tofu. Get the recipes!

videos.title: Dr. Ian Smith
videos.overview: The rise of fast fashion and increasing global production of clothing has many shoppers confused about where to spend a bit more and where to save when it comes to clothes. NBC's Vicky Nguyen stops by TODAY with a closer look at how to find quality garments. From protein-packed lunches to calcium-rich snacks and more, Dr. Ian Smith stops by TODAY to break down the key foods to incorporate into your diet as you age for boosting energy, happiness and life longevity. From intensive hydration serums to retinol creams and more, dermatologist Dr. Michelle Henry stops by TODAY to share the best products to protect your skin from the deep winter chill. John Searles, bestselling author of "Strange but True" joins TODAY to discuss his upcoming novel "Single Girls," based on the world of women's magazines in the 1960s. He also shares his favorite winter book recommendations, including "Water Moon" by Samantha Sotto Yambao, "How to Sleep at Night" by Elizabeth Harris and more. From embracing the joy of missing out, to the social media outcry over the new Chick-fil-A waffle fry recipe and more, take a look at the some of most popular stories on TODAY.com.

videos.title: Jacqueline Andriakos
videos.overview: As surgery to permanently change eye color grows in popularity, the American Academy of Ophthalmology is warning of potential risks, including cloudy vision or loss of vision. NBC's Vicky Nguyen joins TODAY with what you need to know if you're considering the cosmetic procedure. From protecting against norovirus to hydrating your hair and skin, NBC medical contributor Dr. John Torres stops by TODAY to answer questions on common winter health concerns. From a water bottle with a phone stand to affordable grip socks and more, Jacqueline Andriakos stops by TODAY to share winners of the 2025 Women's Health Fitness Awards. What dietary habits reduce inflammation? What snacks boost brain health? TODAY nutrition and health expert Joy Bauer stops by Studio 1A to separate facts from fiction when it comes to healthy eating.

videos.title: Miles McBride, Dr. Samantha Boardman
videos.overview: The town of Newport, Rhode Island, where the 1974 film-adaptation of "The Great Gatsby" was filmed, celebrated the 100th anniversary of F. Scott Fitzgerald's classic American novel by welcoming the return of actor Sam Waterston who shared behind-the-scenes stories with the community. Reporting for TODAY, NBC's Anne Thompson sits down with Waterston and also meets with Newport locals who found their way into the movie. NBC News medical contributor Dr. Natalie Azar and TODAY nutrition and health expert Joy Bauer stop by Studio 1A to break down everything you need to know about intermittent fasting, including how it works, the effects it can have on the body, who should avoid it and more. In Tampa, Florida's historic Ybor City, hundreds of wild chickens are seen freely roaming the streets. The chickens are protected by a decades-old Tampa law that declares the entire city a bird sanctuary, making it illegal to hunt, kill or hurt them in any way. Reporting for TODAY, NBC's George Solis shares an inside look at how residents are now creating foundations and securing funding to protect their wild mascots. Miles "Deuce" McBride joins TODAY to talk about his new children's book called "Deuce: The Champion of Friendship." He opens up about the themes in the book and being able to read the book to his newborn daughter. He also discusses what it is like playing on the Knicks, working under a new coach and more. Psychiatrist Dr. Samantha Boardman joins TODAY to talk about how embodying confidence can help you step into your power. She also shares tips to help people boost their confidence, including dressing to impress, owning your ideas and more.

videos.title: Johnny C. Taylor Jr., Cristin Milioti
videos.overview: Side hustles are not just a good way to make a little extra money, they can also increase your skills and income. Johnny C. Taylor Jr., president and CEO of SHRM, joins TODAY to breakdown the challenges of taking on extra work, the pros and cons of using AI in a side gig, when to consider switching to full time, and more. Actor Cristin Milioti joins TODAY to celebrate "The Penguin's" Emmy nominations and shares insight into how she transformed into her character Sofia Falcone. Milioti says she's "hopeful" for a second season of the HBO series and reveals that she watched "Sex and the City" for the first time to decompress at home. Shop TODAY contributor Chassie Post joins TODAY to share exclusive deals up to 70% off on home basics and upgrades for essentials including a Lands' End Tote, a Tarte eyeshadow palette, cabana towels and more.

videos.title: John Slattery
videos.overview: NBC's Vicky Nguyen joins TODAY to discuss shopping for insurance and finding the best coverage for your home, auto and health. Tips include discount stacking, understanding plan types and more. Actor John Slattery joins TODAY to talk about his new role as Leo Drummond in "The Rainmaker," a series adaptation of John Grisham's legal drama. Slattery discusses how the show differs from the classic movie adaptation and how he made the character his own. He also looks back on 10 years since the "Mad Men" finale and opens up about his continued appreciation for the program. "We all knew how good it was right from the jump," he says. "It was a great run and we all love it." WeightWatchers chief nutrition officer Michelle Cardel joins TODAY to discuss products for everything from the kitchen to gym that will help build healthy habits and lasting success. Items include Hoka sneakers, a nonslip yoga mat, an Owala water bottle, RXBARs and more!

videos.title: Ben Kingsley, Charlie Day
videos.overview: Academy Award-winning actor Sir Ben Kingsley joins TODAY to chat about "The Thursday Murder Club" and shares what drew him to accept project before he even learned what it was. Kingsley also reveals his favorite mid-morning snack when he's on-set: a peanut butter and tomato sandwich! Actor Charlie Day joins TODAY to talk about his new dark comedy, "Honey Don't!," where plays a detective who falls in love with a private eye working the same case. He shares what it was like working with director Ethan Coen, saying, "I hammered Ethan with every question I could because I was like, 'He'll probably never work with me again.'" Day also discusses Season 18 of "It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia," being a dad to his teenage son and then plays a game of Today or Not Today where he weighs in on skydiving, Labubu dolls and more. It can be hard to embrace the unknown and uncomfortable but avoiding those situations can stunt your personal growth. Psychotherapist and author Niro Feliciano joins TODAY to talk about the art of taking risks, its neurological benefits and list steps to help you to master the skill. "It's been proven when we learn new things, we prevent cognitive decline, not to mention if we do well at those things, our reward pathways light up and boosts our dopamine so we're happier," Feliciano says.
